servinfo.title: Engine Vacuum Check
servinfo.ptxt: The engine vacuum that develops in the intake line is a good indicator of the condition of the engine. The vacuum checking procedure is as follows:

s1.ptxt: Warm up engine to normal operating temperature.

attention3.ptxt: After warming up engine, be sure to place transaxle gear shift lever in “Neutral”, and set parking brake and block drive wheels.

s1.ptxt: Stop engine and turn off the all electric switches.
Remove PCV hose (1) from PCV valve (2).
Connect special tool (Vacuum gauge) to PCV hose (1).
Blind PCV valve (2) using tape or the like.
Run engine at specified idle speed and read vacuum gauge. Vacuum should be within specification.

spec.title: Vacuum specification (at sea level)
spec.ptxt: 59 – 73 kPa (45 – 55 cmHg, 17.7 – 21.6 in.Hg) at specified idle speed

s1.ptxt: After checking, disconnect special tool (Vacuum gauge) from PCV hose.
Detach blind cap from PCV valve.
Connect PCV hose to PCV valve.
